Pulaka，[cp．Sk．pulāka，Halāyudha 5，43； not Sk．pulaka，as Kern，Toev．s．v．for which see also Walde，Lat．Wtb．s．v．pilus] shrivelled grain Miln．232 （sukka-yava° of dried barley）； DhA．II，154 （SS； T．reads mūlakaṁ，which is expld by Bdhgh as “nitthusaṁ katvā ussedetvā gahita-yava-taṇḍula vuccanti” ibid）．Here belongs pulasa-patta of J．III，478．（vv．ll．pulā°，mūlā°，mulā°； expld by C．as “saṇhāṇi pulasa-gaccha-paṇṇāni，” thus taking pulasa as a kind of shrub，prob．because the word was not properly understood）．（Page 470）
